verses.english: Therefore, anyone who speaks in a language should pray that he may interpret it.

verses.latin: Si enim orem lingua, spiritus meus orat, mens autem mea sine fructu est.
verses.english: For if I pray in a language, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.

verses.latin: Quid ergo est? Orabo spiritu, orabo et mente: psallam spiritu, psallam et mente.
verses.english: So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my mind. I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my mind.

verses.latin: Alioquin si benedixeris spiritu, qui occupat locum infidelis, quomodo dicet Amen super tuam gratiarum actionem? quia quid dicas, nescit.
verses.english: Otherwise, if you give thanks in the Spirit, how can the one who is present as an outsider say “Amen” to your thanksgiving, since he does not know what you are saying?

verses.latin: Nam tu quidem bene gratias agis, sed alter non ædificatur.
verses.english: For you may be giving thanks well enough, but the other person is not built up.

verses.latin: Gratias ago Deo meo, quod plus omnibus vobis linguis loquor:
verses.english: I give thanks to God that I speak in languages more than all of you.

verses.latin: sed in ecclesia volo magis loqui quinque verba mente mea, ut et alios instruam: quam decem millia verborum in lingua.
verses.english: But in the church, I would rather speak five words with my mind, in order to instruct others, than ten thousand words in a language.

verses.latin: Fratres, nolite pueri esse sensibus: sed malitia parvuli estote, sensibus autem perfecti estote.
verses.english: Brothers and sisters, do not be children in your understanding. Be infants in evil, but in your thinking be mature.

verses.latin: In lege scriptum est: Quia in aliis linguis, et in labiis aliis loquar populo huic, et nec sic exaudient me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: In the Law it is written: “By people of strange tongues and by the lips of foreigners I will speak to this people, and even then they will not listen to me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Itaque linguæ in signum sunt, non fidelibus, sed infidelibus: prophetia autem non infidelibus, sed fidelibus.
verses.english: So languages are a sign, not for believers, but for unbelievers. Prophecy, however, is not for unbelievers but for believers.

verses.latin: Si ergo congregata sit universa ecclesia in unum, et omnes linguis loquantur, intrent autem infideles, aut idiote, nonne dicent quod insanitis?
verses.english: So if the whole Church comes together and all speak in languages, and some unbelievers or uninstructed people come in, will they not say that you are mad?

verses.latin: Si autem omnes prophetent, intret autem aliquis infidelis, vel idiota, arguitur ab omnibus, judicatur ab omnibus:
verses.english: But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or uninstructed person comes in, he is convicted by all and is judged by all.

verses.latin: et ita manifesta fiunt abscondita cordis ejus: et ita cadens in faciem adorabit Deum, pronuntians quod vere Deus in vobis sit.
verses.english: And so the secrets of his heart are disclosed, and, falling on his face, he will worship God, proclaiming that God is really among you.

verses.latin: Quid ergo est, fratres? Cum congregamini, unusquisque vestrum psalmum habet, doctrinam habet, apocalypsim habet, linguam habet, interpretationem habet: omnia ad ædificationem fiant.
verses.english: What then, brothers and sisters? When you come together, each one has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a language, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for building up.

verses.latin: Si lingua quis loquitur, secundum duos, aut ut multum tres, et per partes: et unus interpretetur.
verses.english: If anyone speaks in a language, let there be only two or at most three, and let them speak one at a time, and let someone interpret.

verses.latin: Si autem non fuerit interpres, taceat in ecclesia: sibi autem et Deo loquatur.
verses.english: But if there is no one to interpret, let the speaker keep silent in the church and speak to himself and to God.

verses.latin: Prophetæ autem duo, aut tres loquantur: et ceteri judicent.
verses.english: Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others weigh what is said.

verses.latin: Quod si alii revelatum fuerit sedenti, prior taceat.
verses.english: If anything is revealed to another sitting nearby, let the first one be silent.

verses.latin: Potestis enim omnes per singulos prophetare: ut omnes discant, et omnes exhortentur:
verses.english: For you can all prophesy one by one, so that all may learn and all be encouraged.

verses.latin: et spiritus prophetarum prophetis subditi sunt.
verses.english: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.

verses.latin: Non est enim dissensionis Deus, sed pacis: sicut in omnibus ecclesiis sanctorum.
verses.english: For God is not a God of confusion but of peace. As in all the churches of the saints,

verses.latin: Mulieres in ecclesiis taceant: non enim permittitur eis loqui, sed subditas esse, sicut et lex dicit.
verses.english: let the women keep silent in the churches. For they are not permitted to speak, but should be in submission, as the Law says.

verses.latin: Si quid autem volunt discere, domi viros suos interrogent: turpe est enim mulieri in ecclesia loqui.
verses.english: If there is anything they desire to learn, let them ask their husbands at home. For it is shameful for a woman to speak in church.

verses.latin: An a vobis verbum Dei processit? aut in vos solos pervenit?
verses.english: Did the word of God originate with you? Or has it come only to you?

verses.latin: Si quis videtur propheta esse, aut spiritualis, cognoscat quæ scribo vobis, quia Domini sunt mandata.
verses.english: If anyone thinks that he is a prophet, or spiritual, let him recognize that the things which I am writing to you are the commandments of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quod si quis ignorat, ignorabitur.
verses.english: If anyone does not recognize them, he will not be recognized.

verses.latin: Itaque, fratres, æmulamini prophetare, et loqui linguas nolite prohibere.
verses.english: So, brothers and sisters, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in languages.

verses.latin: Omnia autem decenter, et secundum ordinem fiant.
verses.english: But all things should be done decently and in order.

verses.latin: Fratres, notum vobis facio Evangelium, quod evangelizavi vobis, quod et accepistis, in quo et statis,
verses.english: Brothers, I want you to know the Gospel that I preached to you, that you received, and in which you stand,

verses.latin: per quod et salvati estis: si tenetis formam, in qua illud evangelizavi vobis, nisi credidistis frustra.
verses.english: by which you are saved, if you hold fast to the Gospel that I preached to you, unless you have believed in vain.

verses.latin: Tradidi enim vobis in primis quod et accepi: quoniam Christus mortuus est pro peccatis nostris secundum Scripturas:
verses.english: For I delivered to you first of all what I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

verses.latin: et quia sepultus est, et quia resurrexit tertia die secundum Scripturas:
verses.english: and that He was buried, and that He rose on the third day according to the Scriptures,

verses.latin: et quia visus est Cephae, et postea undecim.
verses.english: and that He was seen by Cephas, and then by the eleven.

verses.latin: Deinde visus est plus quam quingentis fratribus simul: ex quibus plures vivunt usque adhuc, quidam autem dormierunt.
verses.english: After that, He was seen by more than five hundred brothers at once; most of whom are still alive, but some have fallen asleep.

verses.latin: Deinde visus est Jacobo, deinde Apostolis omnibus.
verses.english: Then He was seen by James, and then by all the Apostles.

verses.latin: Novissime autem omnium, tamquam abortivo, visus est et mihi.
verses.english: And last of all, as to one untimely born, He was seen by me also.

verses.latin: Ego enim sum minimus Apostolorum, qui non sum dignus vocari Apostolus: quoniam persecutus sum Ecclesiam Dei.
verses.english: For I am the least of the Apostles, who am not worthy to be called an Apostle, because I persecuted the Church of God.

verses.latin: Gratia autem Dei sum id quod sum, et gratia ejus in me vacua non fuit, sed abundantius illis omnibus laboravi: non ego autem, sed gratia Dei mecum.
verses.english: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace in me has not been in vain. On the contrary, I worked harder than any of them, though it was not I, but the grace of God with me.

verses.latin: Sive enim ego, sive illi: sic praedicamus, et sic credidistis.
verses.english: Whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.

verses.latin: Si autem Christus praedicatur quod resurrexit a mortuis, quomodo dicunt quidam inter vos quoniam resurrectio mortuorum non est?
verses.english: Now if Christ is preached as having been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

verses.latin: Si enim resurrectio mortuorum non est: neque Christus resurrexit.
verses.english: For if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not been raised either.

verses.latin: Si autem Christus non resurrexit: inanis est ergo praedicatio nostra, inanis est et fides vestra.
verses.english: And if Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith is also in vain.

verses.latin: Invenimur autem et falsi testes Dei: quoniam testimonium diximus adversus Deum quod suscitaverit Christum, quem non suscitavit, si mortui non resurgunt.
verses.english: We are even found to be false witnesses of God, because we testified against God that He raised Christ, whom He did not raise if the dead do not rise.

verses.latin: Si enim mortui non resurgunt: neque Christus resurrexit.
verses.english: For if the dead do not rise, then Christ has not been raised either.

verses.latin: Quod si Christus non resurrexit, vana est fides vestra: adhuc enim estis in peccatis vestris.
verses.english: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.

verses.latin: Ergo et qui dormierunt in Christo, perierunt.
verses.english: Then those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

verses.latin: Si in hac vita tantum in Christo sperantes sumus, miserabiliores sumus omnibus hominibus.
verses.english: If in this life only we have hoped in Christ, we are of all men most to be pitied.

verses.latin: Nunc autem Christus resurrexit a mortuis, primitiae dormientium.
verses.english: But now Christ has been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

verses.latin: Quoniam enim per hominem mors, et per hominem resurrectio mortuorum.
verses.english: For since by man came death, by man also came the resurrection of the dead.

verses.latin: Et sicut in Adam omnes moriuntur, ita et in Christo omnes vivificabuntur.
verses.english: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.

verses.latin: Unusquisque autem in ordine suo: primitia Christus: deinde ii qui sunt Christi, qui crediderunt in adventu ejus.
verses.english: But each in his own order: Christ, the firstfruits; then those who are Christ's at His coming.

verses.latin: Deinde finis: cum tradiderit regnum Deo et Patri, cum evacuaverit omnem principatum, et potestatem, et virtutem.
verses.english: Then comes the end, when He delivers the kingdom to God the Father after He has destroyed every rule and every authority and power.

verses.latin: Oportet enim illum regnare, donec ponat omnes inimicos sub pedibus ejus.
verses.english: For He must reign until He has put all His enemies under His feet.

verses.latin: Novissima autem inimica destruetur mors.
verses.english: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.

verses.latin: Omnia enim subjecit sub pedibus ejus. Cum autem dicit: Omnia subjecta sunt, proculdubio praeter eum qui subjecit ei omnia.
verses.english: For He has put all things in subjection under His feet. But when He says, “All things are put in subjection,” it is evident that He is excepted who put all things in subjection to Him.

verses.latin: Cum autem subjecta fuerint illi omnia, tunc ipse Filius subjectus erit ei qui sibi subjecit omnia, ut sit Deus omnia in omnibus.
verses.english: When all things are subjected to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subjected to Him who put all things in subjection to Him, so that God may be all in all.

verses.latin: Alioquin quid facient qui baptizantur pro mortuis? Si omnino mortui non resurgunt: ut quid baptizantur pro illis?
verses.english: Otherwise, what will they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead do not rise at all, why are people baptized for them?

verses.latin: Quid et nos periclitamur omni hora?
verses.english: And why are we in danger every hour?

verses.latin: Quotidie morior per vestram gloriam, fratres, quam habeo in Christo Jesu Domino nostro.
verses.english: I protest by your boasting, brothers, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, that I die every day.

verses.latin: Si secundum hominem ad bestias pugnavi Ephesi, quid mihi prodest? Si mortui non resurgunt, manducemus et bibamus: cras enim moriemur.
verses.english: If, after the manner of men, I fought with beasts at Ephesus, what does it profit me? If the dead do not rise, “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”

verses.latin: Nolite errare: corrumpunt mores bonos colloquia mala.
verses.english: Do not be deceived: “Evil company corrupts good habits.”

verses.latin: Evigilate justi, et nolite peccare: ignorantiam enim Dei quidam habent, ad confusionem vestram dico.
verses.english: Wake up to righteousness and do not sin, for some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.

verses.latin: Sed dicet aliquis: Quomodo resurgunt mortui? qualive corporis specie veniunt?
verses.english: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body do they come?”

verses.latin: Insipiens, tu quod seminas non vivificatur, nisi prius moriatur.
verses.english: Fool! What you sow is not made alive unless it dies.

verses.latin: Et quod seminas, non corpus quod futurum est seminas, sed nudum granum, vel forte tritici, vel alicujus ceterorum:
verses.english: And what you sow, you do not sow that body which shall be, but a bare grain, perhaps of wheat or some other grain.

verses.latin: Deus autem dat illi corpus sicut voluit, et unicuique seminum proprium corpus.
verses.english: But God gives it a body as He has willed, and to each seed a body of its own.

verses.latin: Non omnis caro, eadem caro: sed alia quidem hominum, alia autem pecorum, alia volucrum, alia piscium.
verses.english: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one kind of flesh for humans, another flesh for animals, another for birds, and another for fish.

verses.latin: Et corpora caelestia, et corpora terrestria: sed alia quidem caelestis gloria, alia autem terrestris.
verses.english: There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies, but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.

verses.latin: Alia claritas solis, alia claritas lunae, et alia claritas stellarum: stella enim a stella differt in claritate.
verses.english: There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for star differs from star in glory.

verses.latin: Sic et resurrectio mortuorum. Seminatur in corruptione: resurgit in incorruptione.
verses.english: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.

verses.latin: Seminatur in ignobilitate: resurgit in gloria.
verses.english: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory.

verses.latin: Seminatur in infirmitate: resurgit in virtute.
verses.english: It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.

verses.latin: Seminatur corpus animale: resurgit corpus spiritale. Si est corpus animale, est et spiritale.
verses.english: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

verses.latin: Sic et scriptum est: Factus est primus homo Adam in animam viventem: novissimus Adam in spiritum vivificantem.
verses.english: So also it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living soul.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

verses.latin: Sed non prius quod spiritale, sed quod animale: deinde quod spiritale.
verses.english: However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural; then the spiritual.

verses.latin: Primus homo de terra, terrenus: secundus homo de caelo, caelestis.
verses.english: The first man was from the earth, made of dust; the second man is from heaven.

verses.latin: Qualis terrenus, tales et terreni: et qualis caelestis, tales et caelestes.
verses.english: As was the earthly man, so are those who are earthly; and as is the heavenly man, so also are those who are heavenly.

verses.latin: Et sicut portavimus imaginem terreni, portemus et imaginem caelestis.
verses.english: And just as we have borne the image of the earthly, we will also bear the image of the heavenly.

verses.latin: Hoc autem dico, fratres: quia caro et sanguis regnum Dei possidere non possunt: neque corruptio incorruptionem possidebit.
verses.english: Now this I say, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does corruption inherit incorruption.

verses.latin: Ecce mysterium vobis dico: Non omnes dormiemus: sed omnes mutabimur,
verses.english: Behold, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,

verses.latin: in momento, in ictu oculi, in novissima tuba: tuba enim sonabit, et mortui resurgent incorrupti: et nos mutabimur.
verses.english: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed.

verses.latin: Oportet enim corruptibile hoc induere incorruptionem: et mortale hoc induere immortalitatem.
verses.english: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.

verses.latin: Cum autem mortale hoc induerit immortalitatem: tunc fiet sermo, qui scriptus est: Absorpta est mors in victoria.
verses.english: But when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”

verses.latin: Ubi est, mors, victoria tua? ubi est, inferne, stimulus tuus?
verses.english: “O Death, where is your victory? O Hades, where is your sting?”

verses.latin: Stimulus mortis peccatum est: potentia autem peccati lex.
verses.english: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

verses.latin: Deo autem gratias, qui dedit nobis victoriam per Dominum nostrum Jesum Christum.
verses.english: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Itaque fratres mei dilectissimi, stabiles estote, et immobiles: abundantes in opere Domini semper, scientes quod labor vester non est inanis in Domino.
verses.english: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

verses.latin: De collectione autem sanctorum, sicut disposui in ecclesiis Galatiae, ita et vos facite.
verses.english: Now, regarding the collection for the saints, just as I directed the churches in Galatia, so also you should do.

verses.latin: In una sabbati, unusquisque vestrum apud se ponat, recondens quod ei bene placuerit, ut non, cum venero, tunc collectae fiant eleemosynae.
verses.english: On the first day of the week, let each of you put aside and store up whatever he may have been blessed with, so that there be no collections when I come.

verses.latin: Cum autem venero, quos probaveritis, per epistolas hos mittam ut gratiam vestram in Ierusalem portant.
verses.english: And when I arrive, I will send whoever you approve with letters, to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quod si dignum fuerit ut et ego eam, ibunt mecum.
verses.english: If it is fitting that I go as well, they will go with me.

verses.latin: Venturus sum autem ad vos, cum Macedoniam pertransiero. Macedoniam enim pertransibo.
verses.english: I will come to you after I pass through Macedonia, for I intend to pass through Macedonia.

verses.latin: Apud vos autem fortasse manebo, vel etiam hiemabo, ut vos me deducatis quo proficiscar.
verses.english: Perhaps I will stay with you for a time, or even spend the winter with you, so that you may send me on my way wherever I go.

verses.latin: Nolo enim vos modo in transitu videre: spero enim me aliquantum temporis manere apud vos, si Dominus permiserit.
verses.english: For I do not want to see you just in passing; I hope to remain with you for a while, if the Lord allows.

verses.latin: Manebo autem Ephesi usque ad Pentecosten.
verses.english: But I will stay in Ephesus until Pentecost.

verses.latin: Ostium enim mihi apertum est magnum et evidens: et adversarii multi.
verses.english: For a great and effective door has opened for me, and there are many adversaries.

verses.latin: Si autem venerit Timotheus, videte ut sine timore sit apud vos: opus enim Domini operatur, sicut et ego.
verses.english: If Timothy comes, see that he is without fear among you, for he is doing the work of the Lord, just as I am.

verses.latin: Ne quis ergo illum spernat: sed deducite eum in pace, ut veniat ad me: exspecto enim illum cum fratribus.
verses.english: Therefore, let no one despise him, but send him on his way in peace, that he may come to me. For I am expecting him with the brothers.

verses.latin: De fratre autem Apollo, multum rogavi eum ut veniret ad vos cum fratribus: et utique non fuit voluntas ut nunc veniret: veniet autem cum ei vacaverit.
verses.english: Now, concerning our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers, and he was not at all willing to come now; but he will come when he has the opportunity.

verses.latin: Vigilate, state in fide, viriliter agite, et confortamini.
verses.english: Be vigilant, stand firm in the faith, act like men, and be strong.

verses.latin: Omnia vestra in caritate fiant.
verses.english: Let all that you do be done in love.

verses.latin: Obsecro autem vos, fratres: nostis domum Stephanae, et Fortunati, et Achaici, quoniam sunt primitiae Achaiae, et in ministerium sanctorum ordinaverunt seipsos:
verses.english: Now I urge you, brothers: you know that the household of Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, are the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the service of the saints.

verses.latin: ut et vos subditi sitis hujusmodi, et omni cooperanti et laboranti.
verses.english: I ask that you be subject to such people, and to everyone who works and labors with them.

verses.latin: Gaudeo autem in praesentia Stephanae, et Fortunati, et Achaici, quoniam quod mihi deerat, ipsi suppleverunt:
verses.english: I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.

verses.latin: refecerunt enim spiritum meum et vestrum. Recognoscite igitur hujusmodi.
verses.english: They have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore, acknowledge such people.

verses.latin: Salutant vos ecclesiae Asiae. Salutant vos in Domino multum Aquila et Prisca cum domestica ecclesia sua.
verses.english: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Prisca, together with the church in their house, salute you warmly in the Lord.

verses.latin: Salutant vos fratres omnes. Salutate invicem in osculo sancto.
verses.english: All the brothers salute you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

verses.latin: Salutatio, manu mea Pauli.
verses.english: The greeting is with my own hand—Paul’s.

verses.latin: Si quis non amat Dominum Jesum Christum, sit anathema, maran atha.
verses.english: If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. Maran atha!

verses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri Jesu Christi vobiscum.
verses.english: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

verses.latin: Caritas mea cum omnibus vobis in Christo Jesu. Amen.
verses.english: My love be with all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
